resolution.description: A fix for this issue is checked into the tree and tested.
resolution.name: Fixed

status.description: A resolution has been taken, and it is awaiting verification by reporter. From here issues are either reopened, or are closed.
status.name: Resolved

jorisvandenbossche commented on a change in pull request #7675:
URL: https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7675#discussion_r451768761



##########
File path: ci/scripts/integration_dask.sh
##########
@@ -32,7 +32,11 @@ python -c "import dask.dataframe"
 # pytest -sv --pyargs dask.bytes.tests.test_hdfs
 # pytest -sv --pyargs dask.bytes.tests.test_local
 
-pytest -v --pyargs dask.dataframe.tests.test_dataframe
+# skip failing pickle test, see https://github.com/dask/dask/issues/6374
+pytest -v --pyargs dask.dataframe.tests.test_dataframe -k "not test_dataframe_picklable"
 pytest -v --pyargs dask.dataframe.io.tests.test_orc
+# skip failing parquet tests, see https://github.com/dask/dask/issues/6243
+# test_illegal_column_name can be removed once next dask release is out
+# (https://github.com/dask/dask/pull/6378)
 pytest -v --pyargs dask.dataframe.io.tests.test_parquet \
-  -k "not test_timestamp_index and not test_roundtrip_from_pandas"
+  -k "not test_to_parquet_pyarrow_w_inconsistent_schema_by_partition_fails_by_default and not test_timeseries_nulls_in_schema and not test_illegal_column_name"

Review comment:
       Not familiar enough with sh to know if there is a way to split this string on multiple lines (but also not the most important issue I think for this bash script)

issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

fields.description:
On dask latest:

{code}
=================================== FAILURES ===================================
___________________________ test_dataframe_picklable ___________________________

    def test_dataframe_picklable():
        from pickle import loads, dumps
    
        cloudpickle = pytest.importorskip("cloudpickle")
        cp_dumps = cloudpickle.dumps
    
        d = _compat.makeTimeDataFrame()
        df = dd.from_pandas(d, npartitions=3)
        df = df + 2
    
        # dataframe
        df2 = loads(dumps(df))
        assert_eq(df, df2)
>       df2 = loads(cp_dumps(df))
E       ValueError: unsupported pickle protocol: 5

opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.7/site-packages/dask/dataframe/tests/test_dataframe.py:1623: ValueError
{code}

https://github.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/runs/844367735


Dask master has many more failures: https://github.com/ursa-labs/crossbow/runs/844351816

comments.body: The error with dask latest, that doesn't seem related to pyarrow, but rather an issue with dask's tests in combination with the new cloudpickle release. Opened an issue for it on the dask side: https://github.com/dask/dask/issues/6374

2 of the failures with dask master are known. I opened an issues about it on the dask side a while ago: https://github.com/dask/dask/issues/6243 (with not yet a clear conclusion). I should have opened an issue on our side as well, and probably it's better to skip those tests, so we can actually detect of other tests start failing (as now we just ignore it since it's failing for so long).

There is a third failure that seems new, will look into that:

{code}
______________________ test_illegal_column_name[pyarrow] _______________________

tmpdir = local('/tmp/pytest-of-root/pytest-0/test_illegal_column_name_pyarr0')
engine = 'pyarrow'

    def test_illegal_column_name(tmpdir, engine):
        # Make sure user is prevented from preserving a "None" index
        # name if there is already a column using the special `null_name`
        null_name = "__null_dask_index__"
        fn = str(tmpdir.join("test.parquet"))
        df = pd.DataFrame({"x": [1, 2], null_name: [4, 5]}).set_index("x")
        df.index.name = None
        ddf = dd.from_pandas(df, npartitions=2)
    
        # If we don't want to preserve the None index name, the
        # write should work, but a UserWarning should be raised
        with pytest.raises(UserWarning) as w:
>           ddf.to_parquet(fn, engine=engine, write_index=False)
E           Failed: DID NOT RAISE <class 'UserWarning'>
{code}

cc [~rjzamora] do you have any idea why that test (I think you added it recently) would be failing with pyarrow master? Because from looking at the code, this warning only depends on the _dask dataframe_ itself, before any writing logic with pyarrow comes in.

Interesting - I will look into this.  However, I am already a bit confused, because I am not able to reproduce the failure with the latest pyarrow and dask on my local machine.

Regarding the other dask.dataframe tests that are failing (relating to schema validation) - You are correct to ignore those failures for now - I think it is fine that pyarrow is now preventing the creation of a _metadata file with an inconsistent schema.  In the ongoing dask.dataframe ArrowEngine refactor, it will become the users responsibility to define the schema in cases like this.  In the future, we can try to come up with a way to auto-detect the correct schema if/when this shift of responsibility proves problematic.

Ah, forgot to mention that: I also can't reproduce this locally .. (would for some reason on CI those warnings be suppressed?)

> Regarding the other dask.dataframe tests that are failing (relating to schema validation) - You are correct to ignore those failures for now

Yep, that's what I am doing https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7675

> would for some reason on CI those warnings be suppressed?

Not sure.  It does seem that the UserWarning we are looking for is included in the summary:


{code:java}
 =============================== warnings summary ===============================
6012opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/dask/dataframe/io/tests/test_parquet.py::test_local[pyarrow-pyarrow]
6013  /opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pyarrow/compat.py:24: FutureWarning: pyarrow.compat has been deprecated and will be removed in a future release
6014    warnings.warn("pyarrow.compat has been deprecated and will be removed in a "
6015
6016opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/dask/dataframe/io/tests/test_parquet.py: 18 tests with warnings
6017  /opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/pyarrow/util.py:39: FutureWarning: pyarrow.compat.guid is deprecated as of 1.0.0, please use pyarrow.util.guid instead
6018    warnings.warn(msg, FutureWarning)
6019
6020opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/dask/dataframe/io/tests/test_parquet.py::test_illegal_column_name[pyarrow]
6021  /opt/conda/envs/arrow/lib/python3.8/site-packages/dask/dataframe/io/parquet/core.py:399: UserWarning: If read back by Dask, column named __null_dask_index__ will be set to the index (and renamed to None).
6022    warnings.warn(
6023
6024-- Docs: https://docs.pytest.org/en/latest/warnings.html
6025=========================== short test summary info ============================{code}
Ah, that's a good catch. But then it's even more a mystery to me why it's not catched by pytest ...

Perhaps it is just that the test should be using `pytest.warns` rather than `pytest.raises` to check for a UserWarning - I can submit a PR to dask, but not sure if that will fix this failure (since both work for me locally).

 

EDIT: Opened dask#6378 to try this: [https://github.com/dask/dask/pull/6378]

Ah, good catch. Yeah, I would say that's an error in the dask test.

Now I am actually wondering how this even worked .. ;)

{code}
In [11]: import warnings                                                                                                                                                                                           

In [12]: with pytest.raises(UserWarning) as w: 
    ...:     warnings.warn("test", UserWarning) 
    ...:                                                                                                                                                                                                           
/home/joris/miniconda3/envs/dev/bin/ipython:2: UserWarning: test
  
---------------------------------------------------------------------------
Failed                                    Traceback (most recent call last)
<ipython-input-12-48c4066af4e3> in <module>
      1 with pytest.raises(UserWarning) as w:
----> 2     warnings.warn("test", UserWarning)
      3 

~/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/python_api.py in __exit__(self, *tp)
    734         __tracebackhide__ = True
    735         if tp[0] is None:
--> 736             fail(self.message)
    737         self.excinfo.__init__(tp)
    738         suppress_exception = issubclass(self.excinfo.type, self.expected_exception)

~/miniconda3/envs/dev/lib/python3.7/site-packages/_pytest/outcomes.py in fail(msg, pytrace)
    117     """
    118     __tracebackhide__ = True
--> 119     raise Failed(msg=msg, pytrace=pytrace)
    120 
    121 

Failed: DID NOT RAISE <class 'UserWarning'>
{code}

(so this might depend on some pytest setting)

OK, so now we know why it fails, I am going to skip this test as well at https://github.com/apache/arrow/pull/7675, so the integration tests are green for the rest. We can remove that skip again once the next dask release is out
